title: Autocomplete Feature for Search Engine
description: You are tasked with designing an autocomplete feature for a search engine. The feature should provide a list of suggestions based on the input prefix. The suggestions should be retrieved from a given list of words. The feature should be case-insensitive and should handle duplicate words.

examples.explanation: The output includes all words that start with the prefix 'ap' (case-insensitive).
The output includes all words that start with the prefix 'he' (case-insensitive).
The output includes all words that start with the prefix 'te' (case-insensitive).

constraints.words: The list of words will contain at most 10000 unique words.
constraints.word_length: Each word will have a length between 1 and 100 characters.
constraints.prefix_length: The prefix will have a length between 1 and 100 characters.
constraints.time_complexity: The solution should have a time complexity of O(n + m) where n is the number of words and m is the number of characters in the prefix.

follow_up: How would you handle a large list of words that does not fit into memory?
How would you optimize the solution to provide suggestions in real-time as the user types?
hints: Use a Trie data structure to store the words and provide efficient lookup and retrieval of suggestions.
Use a case-insensitive comparison to handle words with different cases.
Consider using a recursive approach to traverse the Trie and retrieve suggestions.
